result.execSummary:
The defendant Paula J. Christensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court authorizes transfer of probation to Vilas County.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by agent. 

DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paula J. Christensen

defendant.name: Christensen, Paula J.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:03 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Lou Ann Bohn.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Amended Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding. 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 9 months MCJ w/ huber for treatment if def qualifies imposed and STAYED for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 2 days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT authorizes transfer of probation to Vilas County. 

Adj: 2:10 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:48 pm 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Deft does NOT appear - Atty Lou Ann Bohn appears on her behalf.
@1:49 pm Deft now appear and Atty Bohn requests time to speak with her client. 
OTR: 1:49 pm BOTR: 1:47 pm 
Atty Bohn notes parties have an agreement and requests plea hearing be set at later date. 
CC set for 12/2/2015 at 1pm with Br. 3 JA to set plea. 
COURT removes jury trial. 
Adj: 1:59 pm

Prior: 2861 W. Pokegama, Lac Du Flambeau, WI 54538

No contact with victim(s):  Walmart (Rib Mountain). Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
